data.title: Simple, clean querky and convenient.
data.text: We stayed there on two separate nights.  Both times it was clean, quiet with helpful staff and lovely querky room.  The second night we were upgraded to the "penthouse" because we mentioned there was a problem with the electrical sockets in the room we had stayed in.  Karen at the desk was amazing knowledgeable and helpful.  Would definately go back. It is very conveniently placed for the centre of town, the university and the 28th Street shopping centre.

data.title: College Visit
data.text: Great Hotel to stay at if you are going to be visiting your son or daughter at CU Boulder.  Close to everything including Pearl Street and the nearby mall.  The rooms are clean and I found them to be quiet.  The hotel is a great value for the price.

data.title: Best location in Boulder!
data.text:
I had the pleasure of staying at this unique hotel for 5 days in September.  It was quiet, very clean, a spacious room and a fabulous location.  Just a few blocks from Pearl Street and Boulder Creek, this hotel allowed me to walk everywhere.  

I am a retired, single woman, but I felt very safe here (which is my primary concern).  The room was large and decorated very uniquely, showing their local pride.  The staff, from the front desk to the cleaning crew, was very nice.  The community area allowed me to comfortably sit and read a book outside of my room.  

If you are into hiking, biking, climbing or skiing, this is a great place to stay.  There is a hot tub and laundry facilities on site (and a large climbing wall in the community area).  I would definitely stay here again and recommend it highly.

owner_response.author: Jenn T, General Manager at Basecamp Boulder Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at Basecamp Boulder!  We hope you come see us again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Cute and Clean
data.text:
I stayed here in late July for a business trip and had no issues. I was notified in advance by my colleague who chose this hotel that this would not be 'fancy' or have a ton of amenities, which was totally fine by me. The rooms were really cute (loved the whole campsite/camping vibe) and clean. There are different sized rooms and the one downside about the standard room I had, was that the bathroom was tiny. Not the end of the world, but I could see how this could be challenging for more than one person. The bed was really comfy and the AC was cold. Free wi-fi was nice.

I liked that they have a little cafe and breakfast bar if you need to grab & go. They also have free hot tea, coffee, water, oatmeal. granola, and cookies by the check-in area that's available round the clock. The fitness room is quite small, though they do have a Peloton bike which I thought was pretty cool. Didn't have time to check out pool. 

Overall, had a pleasant stay and would recommend it for folks who can embrace the laid back vibe and don't need lots of bells and whistles. It's in a good location, but for those that don't do a lot of walking, it's probably easier if you have a car. The staff was very friendly and happy to help you with questions about local interests (shopping, hiking, restaurants, etc.).

data.title: Old Quality Inn on Arrapahoe is More Expensive and Lower Quality
data.text: We have come to this hotel for almost 20 years, it is under new ownership and is not as good.  They no longer serve breakfast, the pool is gone, the people working here are not as friendly.  The furnishings have been downgraded to a cross between a dorm room, IKEA or a lodge at a National Park but in a Disney style format without soulfulness.  In the past the price was more competitive, it was a green hotel that offered bikes and had recycle bins in the room.  The new format is not very environmentally friendly but I was happy to see they still have solar panels. The new paint in the room has a lot of dings and hair stuck in the paint.  I think the idea is to appeal to younger people, but I would imagine a younger person would prefer Airbnb.  There is also a bad moldy smell in our very cramped bathroom and kitchen cabinets.  Having said all that, the location is still great and there are plenty of healthy grocery stores near by.  They still have free coffee. It is not all bad. If you book here don't use AAA because you can get a cheaper rate for multiple night stays. It's somewhat misleading on the web site.

data.title: Not recommended
data.text: Dirty carpet, AIr conditioner old and not working properly, musty smell in room. Way overpriced.  Entire space felt old and dirty.    So bad, we could not stay here. Neighborhood not the best.  Would have rather stayed anywhere else.  Ended up staying elsewhere that was 10x better for less money.

data.title: Pros and cons
data.text:
I agree with the recent reviewer who said that they were "pretty torn about this hotel." I chose to stay here because I wanted to be within walking distance of downtown Boulder. Between the limited number of downtown hotels and the high rates charged at most of them, I ended up at Basecamp Boulder. I thought it was worth taking a chance based on the recent remodel and fun things like a climbing wall, and I was mostly right.

Pros:
- The location is pretty good. We wanted to be able to walk downtown, and it was an easy walk. The walk isn't particularly beautiful, since you spend the first few blocks walking through an area with lots of student apartments, but that was not a major problem for us.
- The climbing wall was fun (although the room got quite warm). If you are traveling with kids you know that there will sometimes be some time to kill, and whenever we returned to the hotel the kids were thrilled to have a little time to climb around on the wall. That was much better than being stuck in our room and a nice change of pace.
- There is (at least) one very friendly staff member. We didn't find all of the staff to be friendly and attentive, but there was one man (I wish I had gotten his name) who was around the grounds quite often and always offered to help us. This was especially useful because the hotel keeps their bouldering pads locked in a closet and he was always around to get them out for us when the kids wanted to climb the wall.

Cons:
- The desk staff seemed aloof at best. Maybe they were just trying to convey a laid back vibe but it almost felt like they would ignore you.
- The "kitchenette" that was listed on the web site consisted of a cooler and a coffee maker. No fridge, no microwave. I wasn't expecting much, but I think that saying the room has a kitchenette was a pretty big overstatement.

If I was returning to Boulder I would consider staying here again, but it didn't feel like a tremendous value. I would probably have this hotel on my list of places to consider, but would take a close look to see if there are better options available.

data.title: Would not go back
data.text: I booked what I thought was a Quality Inn at this location.  After I spent half an hour looking for the Quality Inn, I called the hotel and found this location is now called Basecamp, an affiliation.  The hotel was not very attractive from the outside.  There was an open corridor that guests had to walk down to access some of the rooms, one of which was mine.  I felt uncomfortable walking in this area.  Upon opening the door to the room, the carpet was noticeably dirty.  The overall decorations were pleasant; the bathroom was very small.  I started a complaint with Quality Inn Customer Care, who informed me the complaint could not actually be placed until I checked out of the hotel.  This was not possible, as I had pre-paid a four night's stay.  Upon checking out, I spoke with the floor manager about the condition of the room, in particular the carpet.  He said he would check it out and look at my bill to see if an adjustment could be made.  To make a long story short, when I called Customer Care again and they called the manager, he denied there was a problem with the carpet and refused to make any adjustments.  Quality Inn Customer Care also would do nothing for me except add some points to my account so I could have one free night's stay at any one of a number of their hotels.  I will not be staying at a Quality Inn or any of their affiliates again.  On the up side, Boulder was a great place to visit; lots of great shops and wonderful restaurants.  Just spend a few dollars more and stay somewhere else.

data.title: Some good, some bad
data.text: I feel pretty torn about this hotel. Some staff was friendly and helpful, some was not. One day our room was cleaned in a timely fashion, another day our room wasn't cleaned until early evening. The rooms are done in a fun, outdoorsy way, but the tiny bathroom missed out on the recent renovation. Location is nice, situated in a nice neighborhood.

data.title: Good little hotel
data.text: We recently stayed for two nights to explore some of the surrounding area. The room was ground floor, we were asked to choose which we preferred - that's a first! It was spotlessly clean. The bed was very comfortable, but too many bed covers during such warm nights. As we had booked through a third party we read the blurb very carefully about what equipment to expect in the room and we were initially disappointed that there was no microwave or fridge but the receptionist, Juliana, who was excellent quickly made sure they were available for us. The whole complex is excellent with a small gym, jacuzzi and sauna and laundry facilities. Ideal for a longer stay but it is not cheap in our opinion.

data.title: Great location and that's it
data.text: Like most of the other reviewers here I agree that the location is great but that is it. It is way overpriced for what you get, the rooms are average, showers looks like they have seen better days and you dare not touch the tapestry behind the bed for fear of what it might contain!

data.title: Great little hotel
data.text:
We stayed at the Basecamp Hotel based on its location and reviews. The reviews are right on target this is a great place. Checking in was fast and no problem, the young lady checking us in was very helpful telling us how to get to where we wanted to go. The hotel is within walking distance of many shops and restaurants.  

The rooms are very clean and updated. We will stay again on our next trip to Boulder. 

I would recommend the Basecamp Hotel to anyone wanting a great place to stay.

data.title: Awesome Base Camp!
data.text:
We chose this hotel mainly for its location because we wanted to be able to walk to all the shops and restaurants we'd want to visit while in Boulder and it's very close. When we got there we were delighted by the cool vibe! Everything has an outdoorsy theme: some of the lights in the room were lanterns, the footstool for the chair was a big metal cooler, and there was a climbing wall set up in the central area/game room. I was missing my gym at home so that was a nice touch :)

They put out fresh cookies in the afternoons which were great to come back to after hiking all day, as was the hot tub. There is breakfast in a little cafe in the morning and we tried it the one day and were not disappointed. Prices are very reasonable and the food was good.

This hotel has so much character and it's a great value for the money.

data.title: Excellent Service at this Adorable Hotel
data.text:
Service and room were top notch: 

Pros- 
We had an awesome time staying at the Basecamp Hotel in Boulder. From the moment we arrived, the service was amazing. When we arrived we were greeted quickly and pleasantly and got into our room in minutes. The room was clean and smelled nice. We didn't have an ice bucket (which was an awesome mini cooler) so I mentioned this on the way out to the front desk attendant and one was delivered to our room while we were at lunch. The fitness center was still being set up but they had two Peloton bikes, though, which were super awesome if you're a cyclist (or not). The hot tub and sauna were great too. Oh! And there's a common area with a rock climbing wall and ping pong!

Cons- 
There were a few gnats around the sink area, probably from the drain, but they weren't much of a bother. The tub could have been bigger for my taste, but I still enjoyed a nice bath (with my celestial seasonings bath salts). The TV channels didn't come in very clearly, so we ended up watching CNN or Netflix off our laptop. Nothing that was a very big deal.

***There are no refrigerators in the room, but there is a yeti cooler and a smaller cooler which holds the ice. If you leave the smaller cooler open filled with ice inside of the yeti cooler, your stuff will stay dry and cold within the bigger yeti cooler***

Location: 

The hotel is walking distance (less than 1.5 miles for us) in multiple directions to shops, restaurants, and grocery stores. Pearl Mall is 1.2 or so miles away, which has brew pubs, shops, and recreational dispensaries if you partake. The city itself boasts beautiful views of the Rockies, so walking is fantastic. There is also a bike checkout down the street, so there's that too. 

We really enjoyed our stay and would absolutely stay here again. 

Highly Recommend!!!

data.title: Good location
data.text: I don't often write negative reviews but I felt it necessary for this property. Service with the exception of one desk clerk was horrid. Rooms, at least ours, had a filthy rug, a small bath with a shower that hit me in the middle of the back and no hand soap at the sink when we checked in. High priced for the quality and if you didn't make you reservations when it was a Quality Inn you had to pay extra for breakfast - just unheard of in this type of property.  The only reasons it is even getting one star are the location and they seem to be making an attempt to be environmentally friendly.

data.title: Trendy moderate priced hotel
data.text: I reserved the Basecamp Hotel because of price and not much was available in Boulder when I was booking hotels so I wasn't sure what I was going to get.  I left feeling okay about the hotel but that's all. The good points- Rooms were clean, spacious and had extremely comfortable beds. Stuff I didn't get- the hotel was recently remodeled in a outdoor trendy motif but it looked like some of the remodeling was done by a weekend DIY guy who thought they knew what they were doing. Example the shower door enclosure can only be opened on one side, (where the toilet is located), so you have to climb over the toilet to get into the shower. Even better, once in the shower there is no handle on the inside of the shower door to get it open so you have to pry the door open.

data.title: Good hotel for Boulder's options
data.text:
After a lot of looking around I decided to take a chance on Basecamp.  I'm happy I did.  There is no Comfort Inn sign like some of the websites show.  It's in a decent location and has a hipster feel.  It's not perfect and was a bit expensive for what you get, but compared to the other More pricey options, this seems to be a good choice.  It will move into the top 10 in Boulder eventually.  
You guys need to replace that Comfort Inn pic on Booking ASAP.

data.title: Campy hotel close to everything!
data.text: Admittedly I am a sucker for a well-appointed hotel and the Basecamp Boulder delivered just the vibe we were looking for to kick off our outdoorsy weekend in Colorado! The decor was adorbs, complete with a stainless steel cooler for an ottoman and a illustrated headboard over the Boulder area that was full of character. Also, the staff upon check in and check out were full of tips and super nice. It embodied the fun, laid back attitude of the area and would be a perfect place to stay if you are checking out CU or want to be walking distance from Pearl Street restaurants and shops. Only complaint is the room wasn't huge and there was no mini bar (bummer), but for our one night stay we didn't mind. Definitely worth the stay!

data.title: Pricey
data.text: This hotel has unique decor (as mentioned in other reviews), but it is definitely overpriced. The room was small - no fridge or microwave - and it was several blocks from Pearl street. I also thought that breakfast was included, but it wasn't. We probably won't stay at this hotel again.

data.title: Unique decor but NO VIEW, and way too expensive
data.text: As many have mentioned, this hotel is in a convenient location and has a cute camp-style decor, reminiscent of old style camping. It is clean, the beds are comfortable, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. But the rooms are mostly small with small windows, absolutely no view of anything but a parking lot, and the prices are absurdly high for what is basically a humble motel. The room has very little storage space for clothes; no drawers, just a few shelves. There's no breakfast included, but at least the parking is free.  We stayed one night, looked at several room options, and then left for a place with space, light and mountain views. If Basecamp were inexpensive, at least under $200, then it would be acceptable, but at well over $200, it's just not worth it with other places in the same general area for about the same price and much better comfort.
